meta.title: ECMAScript 6/7 on the JVM with TypeScript and Vert.x
meta.summary:
I figured it would be a good idea to give you a couple of examples how teaming
  Vert.x and TypeScript helps you use ECMAScript 6 and 7 features on the JVM today.

meta.title: Automatic redeployment in Eclipse IDE
meta.summary: Vert.x 3.1 has (re-)introduced the redeploy feature. This blog post explains how to use this feature in the Eclipse IDE. However, you can easily adapt the content to your IDE.

meta.title: Vert.x 3.2.0 is released!
meta.summary: We are pleased to announce the release of Vert.x 3.2.0!

meta.title: Combine vert.x and mongo to build a giant
meta.summary: This blog post is part of the introduction to Vert.x series. We are now going to replace this JDBC client by the vertx-mongo-client, and thus connect to a Mongo database.

meta.title: Vert.x ES6 back to the future
meta.summary: On October 21th, 2015 we all rejoiced with the return from the past of Marty McFly with his flying car and so on, however in the Vert.x world we were quite sad about our rather old JavaScript support.

meta.title: Using the asynchronous SQL client
meta.summary: Finally, back... This post is the fifth post of the introduction to vert.x blog series, after a not-that-small break. In this post we are going to see how we can use JDBC in a vert.x application.
